ground_truth: Trina tumbles across the galley as the plane straightens out and the gauges drop. They head towards a church on an expanse of open land, and Whip steers the plane away from the church's steeple, but the wing grazes the top. The plane hits the ground, and debris glides past the cockpit as Whip bangs his head and passes out. Through blurred vision, Whip sees Ken leaning to the side in his seat as he is dragged out, while Margaret is slumped next to Trina's still body, her head crushed by a collapsed bulkhead. Smoke blocks Whip's vision as he is pulled away from the plane, with people in white robes helping the passengers. A fire engine arrives, and Whip looks up at a female EMT leaning over him, then turns towards the black smoke rising from the crash site. The broken-off spire from the church lies some distance away from an ambulance as rescue workers help survivors. In a hospital ward, Whip slowly opens his right eye, the other covered by a bandage, and sees a seated man on the TV gesturing as rescue workers push a stretcher behind him. A Channel 12 News field reporter comments live from the site as lights flicker in the background, and cell phone footage on TV shows the descent of the plane swerving and slicing off the church steeple, gliding overhead with both engines on fire, and slamming down on its side as people in white robes run for cover. Whip, his head wrapped in gauze, watches in a daze as the church folks stand and take in the scene from a distance, then slowly approach. Whip averts his gaze from the screen and notices a man in the room wearing a suit with the collar open, staring intently at his cell phone. Charlie turns and Whip smiles as a man in an NTSB jacket enters, followed by law officers, a nurse, and a doctor. The NTSB officer places a recorder on Whip's bed, and Whip nods weakly as the doctor leaves. Craig takes his recorder and leaves with the others, but Charlie stays back, smiles, reaches for a plastic bag, and then leaves. Whip puts his bandaged hand to his mouth as tears flow down his face, shakes his head, takes his cell phone from the plastic bag, and drops it on his stomach. A heavy man with a goatee enters the hospital, wearing Bermuda shorts and dark glasses with earphone wires hanging on each side of his head. He strides to the corridors carrying a bag in his hand and another slung over his shoulder, removes his earphones, and leans over the reception desk.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Trina tumbles across the kitchen as the aircraft straightens out and the dials drop. They head towards a chapel on an expanse of open terrain, and Whip steers the aircraft away from the chapel's spire, but the wing grazes the top. The aircraft hits the earth, and wreckage glides past the cockpit as Whip bangs his head and passes out. Through blurred vision, Whip sees Ken leaning to the flank in his seat as he is dragged out, while Margaret is slumped beside Trina's still form, her head crushed by a collapsed bulkhead. Smoke blocks Whip's vision as he is pulled away from the aircraft, with folks in white robes helping the travelers. A fire truck arrives, and Whip looks up at a female EMT leaning over him, then turns towards the dark smoke rising from the crash site. The broken-off spire from the chapel lies some distance away from an ambulance as rescue workers help survivors. In a hospital ward, Whip slowly opens his right eye, the other covered by a bandage, and sees a seated man on the television gesturing as rescue workers push a stretcher behind him. A Channel 12 News field correspondent comments live from the site as lights flicker in the backdrop, and cell phone footage on television shows the descent of the aircraft swerving and slicing off the chapel spire, gliding overhead with both engines on fire, and slamming down on its side as folks in white robes run for shelter. Whip, his head wrapped in gauze, watches in a daze as the chapel folks stand and take in the scene from a distance, then slowly approach. Whip averts his gaze from the screen and notices a man in the chamber wearing a suit with the collar open, staring intently at his cell phone. Charlie turns and Whip smiles as a man in an NTSB jacket enters, followed by law officers, a nurse, and a physician. The NTSB officer places a recorder on Whip's bed, and Whip nods weakly as the physician leaves. Craig takes his recorder and leaves with the others, but Charlie stays back, smiles, reaches for a plastic sack, and then leaves. Whip puts his bandaged hand to his mouth as tears flow down his face, shakes his head, takes his cell phone from the plastic sack, and drops it on his abdomen. A heavy man with a goatee enters the hospital, wearing Bermuda shorts and dark glasses with earphone wires hanging on each side of his head. He strides to the hallways carrying a sack in his hand and another slung over his shoulder, removes his earphones, and leans over the reception desk.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Trina is tumbled across the galley as the plane is straightened out and the gauges are dropped. The crew heads towards a church on an expanse of open land, and the church's steeple is narrowly avoided by the plane, but the top is grazed by the wing. The ground is hit by the plane, and the cockpit is passed by debris as Whip's head is banged and he passes out. Through blurred vision, Ken is seen by Whip leaning to the side in his seat as he drags him out, while next to Trina's still body, Margaret slumps, her head crushed by a collapsed bulkhead. Smoke blocks Whipâ€™s vision as he pulls himself away from the plane, with the passengers being helped by people in white robes. A fire engine is arriving, and up at a female EMT leaning over him Whip looks, then he turns towards the black smoke rising from the crash site. The broken-off spire from the church is lying some distance away from an ambulance as the survivors are helped by rescue workers. In a hospital ward, Whip's right eye is slowly opened by him, the other covered by a bandage, and on the TV a seated man is seen gesturing as a stretcher is pushed by rescue workers behind him. Comments are made by a Channel 12 News field reporter live from the site as lights flicker in the background, and on TV, cell phone footage shows the descent of the plane swerving, slicing off the church steeple, gliding overhead with both engines on fire, and slamming down on its side as the people in white robes run for cover. Whip, his head wrapped in gauze, watches in a daze as the scene is taken in from a distance by the church folks, and then they slowly approach. From the screen, Whip averts his gaze and notices a man in the room wearing a suit with the collar open, intently staring at his cell phone. Charlie is turned by Whip, who smiles as a man in an NTSB jacket enters, followed by law officers, a nurse, and a doctor. On Whip's bed, a recorder is placed by the NTSB officer, and Whip nods weakly as the doctor leaves. His recorder is taken by Craig, who leaves with the others, but Charlie stays back, smiles, reaches for a plastic bag, and then leaves. Whip puts his bandaged hand to his mouth as tears flow down his face, shakes his head, takes his cell phone from the plastic bag, and drops it on his stomach. A heavy man with a goatee enters the hospital, Bermuda shorts are worn by him along with dark glasses with earphone wires hanging on each side of his head. To the corridors, he strides carrying a bag in his hand and another slung over his shoulder, removes his earphones, and the reception desk is leaned over by him.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Trina tumbles across the galley as the plane levels and gauges drop. They head toward a church on open land, and Whip steers away from the steeple, but the wing grazes it. The plane crashes, debris slides past the cockpit, and Whip bangs his head, passing out. Through blurred vision, he sees Ken leaning in his seat as he's dragged out, while Margaret is slumped next to Trina's lifeless body, her head crushed by a collapsed bulkhead. Smoke obscures Whip's view as he's pulled from the plane by people in white robes. A fire engine arrives, and Whip sees a female EMT leaning over him, then turns to the black smoke from the crash. The broken church spire lies near an ambulance as rescue workers assist survivors. In a hospital, Whip opens his right eye, the other bandaged, and sees a man on TV gesturing as rescue workers push a stretcher. A Channel 12 News reporter comments live as cell phone footage shows the plane's descent, swerving, slicing the steeple, gliding with engines on fire, and crashing as people in white robes run. Whip, head wrapped in gauze, watches in a daze as church folks approach. He averts his gaze and notices a man in a suit staring at his phone. Charlie turns, and Whip smiles as an NTSB officer enters with law officers, a nurse, and a doctor. The officer places a recorder on Whip's bed, and Whip nods weakly as the doctor leaves. Craig takes his recorder and leaves with the others, but Charlie stays, smiles, reaches for a plastic bag, and then leaves. Whip puts his bandaged hand to his mouth, tears flowing, shakes his head, takes his cell phone from the bag, and drops it on his stomach. A heavy man with a goatee enters the hospital, wearing Bermuda shorts and dark glasses with earphones, strides to the corridors with bags, removes his earphones, and leans over the reception desk.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Trina tumbles in the galley as the plane levels and gauges drop. They head towards a church, and Whip steers away, grazing the steeple. The plane crashes, debris passes the cockpit, and Whip passes out. He sees Ken being dragged out, Margaret slumped by Trina's body, her head crushed. Smoke obscures Whip's view as people in white robes help passengers. A fire engine arrives, and Whip sees a female EMT, then the black smoke. The church spire lies near an ambulance as rescue workers assist survivors. In the hospital, Whip opens his eye, the other bandaged, and sees a TV showing a reporter and cell footage of the crash. Whip, head bandaged, watches church folks approach. He notices a man in a suit on his phone. Charlie turns, and Whip smiles as an NTSB officer enters with law officers, a nurse, and a doctor. The officer places a recorder on Whip's bed, and Whip nods. Craig leaves with others, but Charlie stays, smiles, reaches for a bag, and leaves. Whip, tearful, takes his phone from the bag. A heavy man with a goatee enters, wearing Bermuda shorts and dark glasses, earphones hanging, and approaches the reception desk.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Trina, in a moment of chaos and disarray, finds herself tumbling uncontrollably across the narrow confines of the galley as the plane begins to level out and the gauges on the control panel drop dramatically. The aircraft is on a precarious path towards a church situated on a vast stretch of open land. In a desperate maneuver, Whip skillfully steers the plane away from the church's towering steeple, but despite his efforts, the wing of the plane grazes the very top of the structure. The plane then makes a violent impact with the ground, and debris swiftly glides past the cockpit windows as Whip's head strikes something hard, causing him to lose consciousness. Through his blurred and fading vision, Whip catches a glimpse of Ken, who is leaning precariously to one side in his seat as he is being dragged out. Meanwhile, Margaret is slumped lifelessly next to Trina's motionless body, her head tragically crushed by a collapsed bulkhead. Smoke begins to obscure Whip's vision as he is pulled away from the wreckage of the plane, with individuals dressed in white robes assisting the passengers. A fire engine arrives on the scene, and Whip looks up to see a female EMT leaning over him, then turns his gaze towards the ominous black smoke billowing from the crash site. The broken-off spire from the church lies some distance away from an ambulance as rescue workers diligently help the survivors. In the sterile environment of a hospital ward, Whip slowly opens his right eye, the other one covered by a protective bandage, and sees a man seated in front of a TV, gesturing animatedly as rescue workers push a stretcher behind him. A Channel 12 News field reporter is providing live commentary from the crash site, with lights flickering in the background, and cell phone footage on the TV screen shows the plane's terrifying descent, swerving and slicing off the church steeple, gliding overhead with both engines engulfed in flames, and finally slamming down on its side as people in white robes scatter for cover. Whip, his head wrapped in gauze, watches in a daze as the churchgoers stand at a distance, taking in the scene before them, then slowly begin to approach. Whip diverts his gaze from the screen and notices a man in the room, dressed in a suit with the collar open, staring intently at his cell phone. Charlie turns, and Whip manages a weak smile as a man wearing an NTSB jacket enters the room, followed by law enforcement officers, a nurse, and a doctor. The NTSB officer places a recorder on Whip's bed, and Whip nods weakly as the doctor exits the room. Craig retrieves his recorder and leaves with the others, but Charlie lingers, smiles, reaches for a plastic bag, and then departs. Whip brings his bandaged hand to his mouth as tears begin to flow down his face, shakes his head in disbelief, takes his cell phone from the plastic bag, and lets it rest on his stomach. A heavyset man with a goatee enters the hospital, wearing Bermuda shorts and dark sunglasses, with earphone wires dangling on each side of his head. He strides purposefully through the corridors, carrying a bag in one hand and another slung over his shoulder, removes his earphones, and leans over the reception desk.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: In a frantic moment filled with chaos and utter disarray, Trina finds herself helplessly tumbling uncontrollably across the narrow, cramped confines of the galley as the plane itself begins to level out. The gauges on the control panel dramatically drop, indicating the dire situation. The aircraft is on a perilous and precarious path towards a solitary church, which stands amidst a vast, wide-open stretch of land. In a desperate and urgent maneuver, the skilled pilot, Whip, adeptly steers the plane away from the towering steeple of the church. However, despite his determined efforts, the wing of the plane still manages to graze the very top of the structure. The plane then makes a violent, bone-shaking impact with the ground, and pieces of debris swiftly glide past the cockpit windows as Whip's head collides with something hard, causing him to lose consciousness. Through his blurred and progressively fading vision, Whip catches a glimpse of Ken, who is leaning precariously to one side in his seat as he is being dragged out. Meanwhile, Margaret is slumped lifelessly next to Trina's motionless body, her head having been tragically crushed by a collapsed bulkhead. Smoke begins to obscure Whip's vision as he is pulled away from the wreckage of the plane, with individuals dressed in white robes assisting the shocked and dazed passengers. A fire engine arrives with urgency on the chaotic scene, and Whip looks up to see a female EMT leaning over him, then turns his gaze towards the ominous plumes of black smoke billowing from the crash site. The broken-off spire from the church lies some distance away from an ambulance as rescue workers diligently work to help the shaken survivors. In the sterile, clinical environment of a hospital ward, Whip slowly opens his right eye, the other one being covered by a protective bandage. He sees a man seated in front of a TV, gesturing animatedly as rescue workers push a stretcher behind him. A Channel 12 News field reporter is energetically providing live commentary from the crash site, with lights flickering in the background. Cell phone footage on the TV screen shows the plane's terrifying descent, swerving unpredictably and slicing off the church steeple, then gliding overhead with both engines engulfed in fierce flames, only to finally slam down on its side as people in white robes scatter for cover. Whip, his head wrapped in protective gauze, watches in a daze as the churchgoers stand at a distance, taking in the unfolding scene before them, then slowly begin to approach. Whip diverts his gaze from the TV screen and notices a man in the room, dressed in a suit with the collar open, staring intently at his cell phone. Charlie turns, and Whip manages to muster a weak smile as a man wearing an NTSB jacket enters the room, closely followed by law enforcement officers, a nurse, and a doctor. The NTSB officer places a recorder on Whip's bed, and Whip nods weakly as the doctor exits the room. Craig retrieves his recorder and leaves accompanied by the others, but Charlie lingers for a moment, smiles warmly, reaches for a plastic bag, and then also departs. Whip brings his bandaged hand to his mouth as tears begin to flow down his face; he shakes his head in disbelief, takes his cell phone from the plastic bag, and lets it rest on his stomach. A heavyset man with a well-groomed goatee enters the hospital, wearing casual Bermuda shorts and dark sunglasses, with earphone wires dangling on each side of his head. He strides purposefully through the bustling corridors, carrying a bag in one hand and another slung over his shoulder, removes his earphones, and leans over the reception desk.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Trina, caught off balance, tumbles across the galley as the plane begins to straighten out, causing the gauges to drop rapidly. The aircraft, now on a precarious course, heads towards a church situated on a vast expanse of open land. In a desperate maneuver, Whip grips the controls and steers the plane away from the church's steeple, but despite his efforts, the wing grazes the top of the steeple. The plane then makes contact with the ground, and as it crashes, debris slides past the cockpit. In the chaos, Whip's head is violently thrown against the interior, causing him to lose consciousness. As his vision blurs, Whip catches a glimpse of Ken, who is leaning to the side in his seat, being dragged out of the wreckage. Nearby, Margaret is slumped next to Trina's motionless body, her head tragically crushed by a collapsed bulkhead. Smoke begins to fill the air, obscuring Whip's vision as he is pulled away from the wreckage by rescuers dressed in white robes who are assisting the passengers. A fire engine arrives on the scene, and Whip, regaining some awareness, looks up to see a female EMT leaning over him. He then turns his gaze towards the ominous black smoke billowing from the crash site. The broken-off spire from the church lies some distance away, near an ambulance, as rescue workers diligently help the survivors. Later, in a hospital ward, Whip slowly opens his right eye, the other covered by a bandage, and his gaze falls on a television screen where a seated man gestures animatedly while rescue workers push a stretcher behind him. A Channel 12 News field reporter provides live commentary from the crash site, with flickering lights in the background, as cell phone footage on the TV shows the plane's descent, swerving and slicing off the church steeple, gliding overhead with both engines ablaze, and finally slamming down on its side as people in white robes scatter for safety. Whip, his head wrapped in gauze, watches in a daze as the churchgoers stand at a distance, absorbing the scene before slowly approaching. He then shifts his gaze away from the screen and notices a man in the room wearing a suit with the collar open, who is intently focused on his cell phone. Charlie turns towards Whip, who manages a weak smile as a man in an NTSB jacket enters the room, followed by law officers, a nurse, and a doctor. The NTSB officer places a recorder on Whip's bed, and Whip nods weakly as the doctor exits the room. Craig retrieves his recorder and leaves with the others, but Charlie lingers, offering a smile before reaching for a plastic bag and then departing. Overcome with emotion, Whip brings his bandaged hand to his mouth as tears stream down his face. He shakes his head, retrieves his cell phone from the plastic bag, and lets it rest on his stomach. A heavyset man with a goatee enters the hospital, dressed in Bermuda shorts and dark glasses, with earphone wires dangling on each side of his head. He strides purposefully through the corridors, carrying a bag in one hand and another slung over his shoulder, removes his earphones, and leans over the reception desk.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description:
Trina tumbles across the galley as the plane stabilizes and the gauges drop. The aircraft heads toward a church, and Whip maneuvers it away, but the wing grazes the steeple. Upon impact, debris slides past the cockpit, and Whip loses consciousness after hitting his head. Through blurred vision, he sees Ken being dragged out of his seat and Margaret slumped next to Trina's lifeless body, her head crushed by a collapsed bulkhead. Smoke obscures Whip's view as he is pulled from the wreckage by people in white robes assisting passengers. A fire engine arrives, and Whip notices a female EMT leaning over him before turning to see black smoke rising from the crash site. The church's broken spire lies near an ambulance as rescue workers aid survivors.

In the hospital, Whip opens his unbandaged eye and sees a TV showing a Channel 12 News field reporter at the crash site, with footage of the plane's descent, the steeple being sliced off, and the fiery crash. Whip, dazed and with his head wrapped in gauze, watches as church members observe the scene and slowly approach. He diverts his gaze to a man in the room, Charlie, who is focused on his cell phone. Whip smiles as an NTSB officer enters with law officers, a nurse, and a doctor. The officer places a recorder on Whip's bed, and Whip nods weakly as the doctor departs. After the others leave, Charlie stays back briefly, smiles, retrieves a plastic bag, and exits. Whip, overwhelmed with emotion, puts his bandaged hand to his mouth, tears flowing, and drops his cell phone from the bag onto his stomach.

A heavyset man with a goatee enters the hospital, wearing Bermuda shorts and dark glasses with earphones dangling. He strides through the corridors with bags in hand and over his shoulder, removes his earphones, and leans over the reception desk.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Trina tumbles across the galley as the plane, struggling to regain control after a severe storm, straightens out and the gauges drop. They head towards a church on an expanse of open land, a historic building known for its community outreach programs, and Whip steers the plane away from the church's steeple, but the wing grazes the top, dislodging bricks as it passes. The plane hits the ground, and debris glides past the cockpit as Whip bangs his head against the control panel and passes out. Through blurred vision, Whip sees Ken leaning to the side in his seat as he is dragged out by emergency responders, while Margaret is slumped next to Trina's still body, her head crushed by a collapsed bulkhead that failed under the impact. Smoke, billowing from the damaged engines, blocks Whip's vision as he is pulled away from the plane, with people in white robes, members of a nearby religious retreat, helping the passengers. A fire engine, part of the robust disaster response team from the local district, arrives, and Whip looks up at a female EMT leaning over him, checking his vital signs, then turns towards the black smoke rising from the crash site. The broken-off spire from the church, a symbol of the building's long-standing presence in the area, lies some distance away from an ambulance as rescue workers help survivors. In a hospital ward, Whip slowly opens his right eye, the other covered by a bandage, and sees a seated man on the TV gesturing as rescue workers push a stretcher behind him. A Channel 12 News field reporter, known for their on-the-ground coverage of emergencies, comments live from the site as lights flicker in the background, and cell phone footage on TV shows the descent of the plane swerving and slicing off the church steeple, gliding overhead with both engines on fire, and slamming down on its side as people in white robes run for cover. Whip, his head wrapped in gauze after receiving stitches, watches in a daze as the church folks stand and take in the scene from a distance, then slowly approach, concerned for the plane's passengers. Whip averts his gaze from the screen and notices a man in the room wearing a suit with the collar open, staring intently at his cell phone, monitoring updates about the crash. Charlie turns and Whip smiles as a man in an NTSB jacket, indicating his role in investigating such accidents, enters, followed by law officers, a nurse, and a doctor. The NTSB officer places a recorder on Whip's bed, an essential tool for collecting eyewitness accounts, and Whip nods weakly as the doctor leaves, satisfied with his condition. Craig takes his recorder and leaves with the others, but Charlie stays back, smiles, reaches for a plastic bag, and then leaves. Whip puts his bandaged hand to his mouth as tears flow down his face, overwhelmed by the crash's aftermath, shakes his head, takes his cell phone from the plastic bag, and drops it on his stomach. A heavy man with a goatee enters the hospital, wearing Bermuda shorts and dark glasses with earphone wires hanging on each side of his head, suggesting he might be a visitor from a recent vacation or someone seeking anonymity. He strides to the corridors carrying a bag in his hand and another slung over his shoulder, removes his earphones, and leans over the reception desk, perhaps to inquire about a passenger from the flight.

test_cases.description: Trina tumbles across the galley as the plane straightens out and the gauges drop. They head towards a church on an expanse of open land and Whip steers the plane away from the church's steeple but the wing grazes the top. The plane hits the ground and debris glides past the cockpit as Whip bangs his head and passes out. Through blurred vision Whip sees Ken leaning to the side in his seat as he is dragged out while Margaret is slumped next to Trina's still body her head crushed by a collapsed bulkhead. Smoke blocks Whip's vision as he is pulled away from the plane with people in white robes helping the passengers. A fire engine arrives and Whip looks up at a female EMT leaning over him then turns towards the black smoke rising from the crash site. The brokenoff spire from the church lies some distance away from an ambulance as rescue workers help survivors. In a hospital ward Whip slowly opens his right eye the other covered by a bandage and sees a seated man on the TV gesturing as rescue workers push a stretcher behind him. A Channel 12 News field reporter comments live from the site as lights flicker in the background and cell phone footage on TV shows the descent of the plane swerving and slicing off the church steeple gliding overhead with both engines on fire and slamming down on its side as people in white robes run for cover. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the cityâ€™s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles natureâ€™s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Whip his head wrapped in gauze watches in a daze as the church folks stand and take in the scene from a distance then slowly approach. Whip averts his gaze from the screen and notices a man in the room wearing a suit with the collar open staring intently at his cell phone. Charlie turns and Whip smiles as a man in an NTSB jacket enters followed by law officers a nurse and a doctor. The NTSB officer places a recorder on Whip's bed and Whip nods weakly as the doctor leaves. Craig takes his recorder and leaves with the others but Charlie stays back smiles reaches for a plastic bag and then leaves. Whip puts his bandaged hand to his mouth as tears flow down. his face shakes his head takes his cell phone from the plastic bag and drops it on his stomach. A heavy man with a goatee enters the hospital wearing Bermuda shorts and dark glasses with earphone wires hanging on each side of his head. He strides to the corridors carrying a bag in his hand and another slung over his shoulder removes his earphones and leans over the reception desk.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: Trina tumbles across the galley as the plane straightens out and the gauges drop. They head towards a church on an expanse of open land and Whip steers the plane away from the church's steeple but the wing grazes the top. The plane hits the ground and debris glides past the cockpit as Whip bangs his head and passes out. Through blurred vision Whip sees Ken leaning to the side in his seat as he is dragged out while Margaret is slumped next to Trina's still body her head crushed by a collapsed bulkhead. Smoke blocks Whip's vision as he is pulled away from the plane with people in white robes helping the passengers. Whip puts his bandaged hand to his mouth as tears flow down. his face shakes his head takes his cell phone from the plastic bag and drops it on his stomach. A heavy man with a goatee enters the hospital wearing Bermuda shorts and dark glasses with earphone wires hanging on each side of his head. He strides to the corridors carrying a bag in his hand and another slung over his shoulder removes his earphones and leans over the reception desk.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~80%)
test_cases.description: Trina tumbles across the galley as the plane straightens out and the gauges drop. They head towards a church on an expanse of open land and Whip steers the plane away from the church's steeple but the wing grazes the top. A heavy man with a goatee enters the hospital wearing Bermuda shorts and dark glasses with earphone wires hanging on each side of his head. He strides to the corridors carrying a bag in his hand and another slung over his shoulder removes his earphones and leans over the reception desk.

test_cases.name: Subject Corruption
test_cases.description: Terrence tumbles across the park as the boat straightens out and the gauges drop. They head towards a library on an expanse of open land, and Betty steers the boat away from the library's steeple, but the wing grazes the top. The boat hits the ground, and debris glides past the cockpit as Betty bangs her head and passes out. Through blurred vision, Betty sees Gary leaning to the side in his seat as he is dragged out, while Linda is slumped next to Terrence's still body, her head crushed by a collapsed bulkhead. Smoke blocks Betty's vision as she is pulled away from the boat, with people in white robes helping the passengers. A fire engine arrives, and Betty looks up at a male EMT leaning over her, then turns towards the black smoke rising from the crash site. The broken-off spire from the library lies some distance away from a helicopter as rescue workers help survivors. In a hospital ward, Betty slowly opens her left eye, the other covered by a bandage, and sees a standing woman on the TV gesturing as rescue workers push a stretcher behind her. A Channel 12 News field reporter comments live from the site as lights flicker in the background, and cell phone footage on TV shows the descent of the boat swerving and slicing off the library steeple, gliding overhead with both engines on fire, and slamming down on its side as people in white robes run for cover. Betty, her head wrapped in gauze, watches in a daze as the library folks stand and take in the scene from a distance, then slowly approach. Betty averts her gaze from the screen and notices a woman in the room wearing a dress with the collar open, staring intently at her cell phone. Roger turns and Betty smiles as a woman in an NTSB jacket enters, followed by law officers, a nurse, and a doctor. The NTSB officer places a recorder on Betty's bed, and Betty nods weakly as the doctor leaves. Susan takes her recorder and leaves with the others, but Roger stays back, smiles, reaches for a plastic bag, and then leaves. Betty puts her bandaged hand to her mouth as tears flow down her face, shakes her head, takes her cell phone from the plastic bag, and drops it on her stomach. A tall man with a beard enters the hospital, wearing Bermuda shorts and dark glasses with earphone wires hanging on each side of his head. He strides to the corridors carrying a bag in his hand and another slung over his shoulder, removes his earphones, and leans over the reception desk.

test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Trina tumbles across the warehouse as the ship straightens out and the thermometers drop. They head towards a library on an expanse of open land, and Whip steers the ship away from the library's dome, but the mast grazes the top. The ship hits the ground, and paper glides past the cabin as Whip bangs his head and passes out. Through blurred vision, Whip sees Ken leaning to the side in his seat as he is dragged out, while Margaret is slumped next to Trina's still body, her head crushed by a collapsed crate. Mist blocks Whip's vision as he is pulled away from the ship, with people in white uniforms helping the passengers. A water tanker arrives, and Whip looks up at a female paramedic leaning over him, then turns towards the gray mist rising from the crash site. The broken-off dome from the library lies some distance away from a van as rescue workers help survivors. In a medical ward, Whip slowly opens his right eye, the other covered by a bandage, and sees a seated man on the radio gesturing as rescue workers push a wheelchair behind him. A Channel 12 News field reporter comments live from the site as lamps flicker in the background, and tablet footage on the TV shows the descent of the ship swerving and slicing off the library dome, gliding overhead with both sails on fire, and slamming down on its side as people in white uniforms run for cover. Whip, his head wrapped in gauze, watches in a daze as the library patrons stand and take in the scene from a distance, then slowly approach. Whip averts his gaze from the screen and notices a man in the room wearing a sweater with the collar open, staring intently at his tablet. Charlie turns and Whip smiles as a man in a Coast Guard jacket enters, followed by law officers, a nurse, and a doctor. The Coast Guard officer places a recorder on Whip's bed, and Whip nods weakly as the doctor leaves. Craig takes his recorder and leaves with the others, but Charlie stays back, smiles, reaches for a paper bag, and then leaves. Whip puts his bandaged hand to his mouth as tears flow down his face, shakes his head, takes his tablet from the paper bag, and drops it on his stomach. A heavy man with a goatee enters the hospital, wearing hiking boots and dark glasses with earphone wires hanging on each side of his head. He strides to the corridors carrying a sack in his hand and another slung over his shoulder, removes his earphones, and leans over the information desk.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Trina dances across the galley as the plane swerves and the gauges rise. They drift towards a church on an expanse of open land, and Whip circles the plane around the church's steeple, but the wing hovers just above. The plane glides into the ground, and confetti flutters past the cockpit as Whip scratches his head and dozes off. Through hazy vision, Whip observes Ken lounging to the side in his seat as he is lifted out, while Margaret is perched next to Trina's still body, her head cushioned by a collapsed bulkhead. Mist blurs Whip's vision as he is carried away from the plane, with people in white robes comforting the passengers. A fire engine pauses, and Whip glances up at a female EMT standing over him, then shifts towards the white clouds rising from the crash site. The broken-off spire from the church stands some distance away from an ambulance as rescue workers guide survivors. In a hospital ward, Whip gently closes his right eye, the other shaded by a bandage, and observes a seated man on the TV gesturing as rescue workers stroll with a stretcher behind him. A Channel 12 News field reporter narrates live from the site as lights glow in the background, and cell phone footage on TV displays the rise of the plane swooping and lifting the church steeple, floating overhead with both engines silent, and careening down on its side as people in white robes gather for cover. Whip, his head wrapped in gauze, watches in a trance as the church folks stand and take in the scene from a distance, then gradually retreat. Whip shifts his attention from the screen and observes a man in the room dressed in a suit with the collar loose, focusing intently on his cell phone. Charlie turns and Whip grins as a man in an NTSB jacket enters, followed by law officers, a nurse, and a doctor. The NTSB officer places a recorder on Whip's bed, and Whip nods slightly as the doctor approaches. Craig takes his recorder and approaches with the others, but Charlie stays back, smirks, searches for a plastic bag, and then approaches. Whip puts his bandaged hand to his mouth as tears form on his face, nods his head, takes his cell phone from the plastic bag, and balances it on his stomach. A heavy man with a goatee enters the hospital, wearing Bermuda shorts and dark glasses with earphone wires dangling on each side of his head. He strolls to the corridors carrying a bag in his hand and another swung over his shoulder, removes his earphones, and leans against the reception desk.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Bianca rolls across the deck as the submarine evens out and the dials plummet. They head towards an observatory on a stretch of barren ice, and Sam guides the submarine away from the observatory's tower, but the sail scrapes the top. The submarine crashes into the iceberg, and shrapnel floats past the bridge as Sam knocks his elbow and blacks out. Through hazy sight, Sam sees Pat leaning to the side in his booth as he is pulled out, while Jamie is slouched next to Bianca's silent figure, her helmet crushed by a fallen partition. Fog obscures Sam's view as he is dragged away from the submarine, with creatures in wool coats aiding the sailors. A tugboat arrives, and Sam glances up at a male paramedic bending over him, then turns towards the gray haze rising from the impact zone. The shattered mast from the observatory lies some distance away from a canoe as rescue divers assist sailors. In an infirmary bay, Sam slowly opens his left eye, the other covered by a splint, and sees a standing woman on the screen gesturing as rescue divers carry a board behind her. A Channel 6 Weather analyst narrates live from the area as signals blink in the distance, and drone footage on screen displays the descent of the submarine swerving and shaving off the observatory tower, drifting overhead with both sonar arms on fire, and clattering down on its side as creatures in wool coats scramble for safety. Sam, his elbow wrapped in bandages, observes in a trance as the observatory visitors stand and absorb the scene from afar, then cautiously advance. Sam shifts his eyes from the screen and notices a woman in the ward wearing a sweater with the sleeves rolled up, fixated on her pager. Danny turns and Sam grins as a woman in a Coast Guard shirt arrives, shadowed by security agents, a medic, and a therapist. The Coast Guard agent places a notepad on Sam's cot, and Sam nods feebly as the therapist departs. Frank retrieves his notepad and departs with the rest, but Danny lingers, grins, reaches for a paper envelope, and then exits. Sam presses his wrapped elbow to his cheek as tears streak down his face, shakes his head, retrieves his pager from the paper envelope, and lays it on his ribcage. A bulky figure with a beard enters the infirmary, wearing cargo pants and tinted goggles with headphone cords drooping on each side of his neck. He marches towards the corridors bearing a box in one hand and another draped over his back, removes his headphones, and leans across the help desk.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Trisha rolls across the hallway as the boat steadies out and the dials rise. They drift towards a palace on an expanse of open water, and Chip guides the boat away from the palace's tower, but the mast brushes the top. The boat touches the shore, and waves drift past the helm as Chip knocks his knee and falls asleep. Through distorted vision, Chip sees Ben leaning forward in his chair as he is pushed out, while Maria is sprawled next to Trisha's still body, her arm crushed by a fallen masthead. Fog obscures Chip's sight as he is carried away from the boat, with individuals in red cloaks assisting the passengers. A lifeboat arrives, and Chip peers up at a male EMT crouching over him, then glances towards the gray mist rising from the wreckage. The broken-off tower from the palace lies some distance away from a helicopter as aid workers assist survivors. In a clinic unit, Chip gradually opens his left eye, the other covered by a patch, and sees a standing woman on the TV waving as aid workers pull a trolley behind her. A Channel 9 News studio host discusses live from the location as sirens wail in the background, and tablet footage on TV shows the rise of the boat swaying and clipping the palace tower, resting nearby with both sails torn, and crashing down on the side as individuals in red cloaks scatter for cover. Chip, his head wrapped in bandages, stares blankly as the palace guards stand and observe the wreck from afar, then slowly walk closer. Chip turns his eyes away from the screen and notices a woman in the room wearing a dress with the collar open, focusing intently on her tablet. Charlie turns and Chip laughs as a woman in an FBI jacket arrives, followed by security personnel, a caretaker, and a surgeon. The FBI agent places a notepad on Chip's bed, and Chip nods faintly as the surgeon exits. Grant takes his notepad and departs with the others, but Charlie remains, grins, picks up a paper bag, and then exits. Chip puts his bandaged hand to his nose as sobs escape his lips, nods his head, takes his tablet from the paper bag, and places it on his chest. A tall woman with a ponytail enters the clinic, wearing cargo pants and a sunhat with ribbon strings dangling on each side of her face. She marches to the lobby carrying a bottle in her hand and another tucked under her arm, removes her ribbon strings, and peers over the information counter.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Trina cartwheels across the kitchen as the blimp balances out and the dials rise. They sail towards a barn on an expanse of rocky shore, and Whip guides the blimp away from the barn's chimney, but the fin brushes the corner. The blimp bounces off the water, and dust drifts past the window as Whip taps his head and falls asleep. Through foggy vision, Whip sees Ken tilting to the side in his seat as he is hoisted out, while Margaret is sprawled next to Trina's motionless body, her arm trapped by a fallen door. Mist obscures Whip's sight as he is lifted away from the blimp, with people in blue uniforms assisting the travelers. A police car arrives, and Whip glances up at a female firefighter bending over him, then shifts towards the white mist rising from the collision site. The broken-off vane from the barn lies some distance away from a helicopter as medical staff aid the injured. In a medical bay, Whip gradually opens his left eye, the other masked by a wrap, and sees a standing woman on the TV nodding as aides roll a wheelchair behind her. A Channel 6 News anchor reports live from the location as shadows dance in the backdrop, and video footage on TV displays the ascent of the blimp veering and clipping off the barn chimney, floating overhead with both rotors sparking, and tumbling over on its back as people in blue uniforms scatter for safety. Whip, his head enveloped in cotton, observes in a haze as the locals stand and take in the panorama from afar, then slowly gather. Whip diverts his eyes from the screen and notices a woman in the room wearing a dress with the buttons undone, gazing intently at her tablet. Charlie turns and Whip grins as a woman in an FAA vest arrives, accompanied by security officers, a janitor, and a therapist. The FAA officer places a laptop on Whip's lap, and Whip nods feebly as the therapist exits. Craig picks up his laptop and exits with the others, but Charlie remains, grins, picks up a paper bag, and then exits. Whip presses his wrapped hand to his mouth as tears roll down his cheeks, shakes his head, takes his tablet from the paper bag, and rests it on his chest. A thin man with a ponytail enters the clinic, wearing jogging pants and yellow glasses with headphone cables dangling on each side of his head. He marches to the hallways carrying a briefcase in his hand and another slung over his shoulder, unplugs his headphones, and leans against the service counter.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Eliza skids past the library as the helicopter levels out and the monitors rise. They travel towards a castle on a stretch of dense forest, and Max pilots the helicopter away from the castle's turret, but the rotor clips the top. The helicopter scrapes the ocean, and shrapnel floats past the cabin as Max taps his foot and falls asleep. Through hazy sight, Max sees Joe reclining to the back in his seat as he is wheeled out, while Lisa is slouched next to Eliza's motionless figure, her arm crushed by a fallen partition. Fog obscures Max's sight as he is carried away from the helicopter, with people in purple suits assisting the explorers. A delivery truck arrives, and Max glances up at a male nurse standing over him, then turns towards the white mist rising from the landing zone. The broken-off turret from the castle rests some distance away from a police car as medical staff aid adventurers. In a forest clearing, Max slowly opens his left hand, the other wrapped by a glove, and sees a crouched dog on the laptop clicking as explorers pull a cart behind him. A Channel 9 Weather team observer discusses live from the scene as shadows flicker in the foreground, and drone footage on the laptop shows the descent of the helicopter wobbling and shaving off the castle turret, soaring underneath with both propellers afire, and splashing down on its back as people in purple suits scramble for shelter. Max, his chest wrapped in bandages, observes in confusion as the castle residents stand and observe the situation from afar, then gradually approach. Max diverts his focus from the display and notices a child in the cabin wearing a hat with the brim up, peering closely at his tablet. Stanley rotates and Max grins as a pilot in an FAA vest arrives, followed by paramedics, a scientist, and a chef. The FAA pilot places a microphone on Max's couch, and Max gestures weakly as the chef exits. Alan grabs his microphone and exits with the rest, but Stanley remains, grins, reaches for a cardboard box, and then departs. Max raises his gloved hand to his forehead as tears stream down his cheeks, nods his head, takes his tablet from the cardboard box, and lays it on his abdomen. A thin woman with a ponytail enters the forest, wearing jeans and bright sandals with headphone wires dangling on each side of her neck. She marches to the trails carrying a case in her hand and another strapped over her shoulder, removes her headphones, and leans over the guidance post.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby cafÃ©, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Trina is thrown across the galley as the plane loses control. Whip narrowly avoids a church steeple, but the wing grazes it before crashing. Whip sees injured passengers, including Margaret beside Trina's lifeless body, before passing out. As smoke fills the air, rescuers help, and a fire engine arrives. At the hospital, Whip watches news footage of the crash, showing the plane's fiery descent and the church steeple's destruction. Whip, bandaged and dazed, sees a man in a suit and meets Charlie, who smiles as an NTSB officer records Whip's statement. After everyone leaves, Whip is emotional, holding his cell phone. A heavy man with a goatee arrives at the hospital, carrying bags and approaches the reception desk.
